title: UPCORE: Utility-Preserving Coreset Selection for Balanced Unlearning
author: Vaidehi Patil (UNC Chapel Hill), Elias Stengel-Eskin (UNC Chapel Hill), Mohit Bansal (UNC Chapel Hill), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses techniques for efficiently removing specific information from models, which could inform approaches to enhancing privacy and ethical considerations in audio processing models.
background: This paper addresses the task of machine unlearning, which involves removing particular knowledge from a trained model without needing to retrain it from scratch.
contribution: UPCORE introduces a method for selecting a coreset that minimizes collateral damage during unlearning, achieving a balance between effective deletion of information and preserving model performance.
technical_comparison: Previous methods often indiscriminately applied unlearning techniques, leading to significant degradation of model performance on unrelated tasks. This work improves by systematically pruning outliers from the forget set to reduce variance and thus minimize collateral damage.
key_innovation: The novel aspect of UPCORE lies in its reliance on hidden state variance to identify outliers, which allows for better preservation of model utility while performing unlearning.
real_world_impact: This framework has the potential to enhance data privacy compliance in machine learning applications, mitigating the negative effects of unlearning processes in practical scenarios.
limitations: No limitations explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.machine unlearning: **Machine unlearning** refers to the ability to efficiently remove data from machine learning models without requiring complete retraining, allowing models to comply with data privacy regulations.
new_terms.coreset: **Coreset** is a small, representative subset of a dataset that captures the essential characteristics of the full dataset, often used to improve computational efficiency.

open_sourcing: The authors have made their code and data available at: https://github.com/Vaidehi99/UPCORE
